nodes.label: Studied Art and Computer Science
nodes.description: Graduated with a BFA in Drawing and Painting, with interdisciplinary studies in Computer Science, Art History, and the Humanities. Took a gap year to prepare for an MFA, but never went—instead designing app interfaces for a new device called the iPhone.

nodes.label: Move to San Francisco
nodes.description: A potential path that wasn't taken—exploring what might have happened with an earlier move to the Bay Area.

nodes.label: Started Xhatch, my own company
nodes.description: Started my own company, learning firsthand what it means to build products, work with clients, and run a business. This experience shaped my understanding of entrepreneurship and the challenges of building something from scratch.

nodes.label: Watched Bret Victor's 'Inventing on Principle'
nodes.description: Fell in love with creative tools after watching this inspiring talk in the worst hotel conference room ever.

nodes.label: Joined One Medical
nodes.description: Led product design during One Medical's critical transition to virtual care and eventual IPO. Designed experiences that transformed how primary care is delivered, making healthcare more accessible and human-centered. The work reinforced my belief that design can transform industries, even ones as complex and regulated as healthcare.

nodes.label: Joined Webflow
nodes.description: Joined as the first Head of Design, building the design foundation from the ground up. Helped scale both the design team and the company's vision for a more expressive, accessible internet. Built processes and systems that would support the company's long-term vision while shipping features that delighted users.

nodes.label: Made first Angel Investment
nodes.description: Made my first angel investment, beginning a journey that would lead to investing in over 30 companies by 2024. Focused on early-stage startups at the intersection of creativity, code, and community.

nodes.label: Joined Replit
nodes.description: Served as VP of Marketing and Design, leading the rebrand that repositioned Replit from a hobby app to a professional AI-native software development platform. Launched developer events and pushed forward new ways to ship AI-native products. The rebrand honored the history of software while embracing the future of AI.

nodes.label: Joined Atlassian
nodes.description: Currently serving as VP and Head of Design, AI, helping shape the future of work through generative AI and systems design. Leading design for Rovo, Atlassian's AI-powered knowledge assistant that breaks down silos by connecting teams, work, and applications across the entire SaaS ecosystem.
